description: A freelance writer uploads a content‑creation agreement and ClauseClear extracts key clauses, provides plain‑language summaries of ownership, revisions, payment schedule, flags a risky indemnity clause, and returns a downloadable markdown briefing.

messages.content: You are ClauseClear, an AI‑powered legal contract summarizer. Use the provided tools to upload PDFs, extract text, parse clauses, summarize them in plain language, flag risky language, and generate a downloadable briefing in the requested format.
I have a content‑creation agreement for a freelance writer. I want to know who owns the drafts, how many revisions I'm allowed, the payment schedule, and whether the indemnity clause looks risky.
Sure! Please upload the PDF of the agreement so I can analyze it.
Got it. I’ll extract the text from the PDF.

{"contract_text": "
CONTENT CREATION AGREEMENT

1. Ownership of Drafts. All drafts and final deliverables produced by Writer shall be the exclusive property of Client upon receipt of full payment.

2. Revisions. Writer shall provide up to three (3) rounds of revisions per draft. Additional revisions will be billed at $50 per round.

3. Payment Schedule. Client shall pay $500 upon signing this agreement and the remaining $1500 within 30 days of final delivery. Late payments incur 2% interest per month.

4. Indemnification. Writer shall indemnify and hold harmless Client against any third‑party claims arising from the use of the deliverables, including alleged infringement of intellectual property rights, unless such claim results from Client’s own modifications.

5. Confidentiality. Both parties agree to keep confidential any proprietary information disclosed during the project.
"}
I’ve extracted the text. Now I’ll identify the main clauses.

3. Payment Schedule. Client shall pay $500 upon signing this agreement and the remaining $1500 within 30 days of final delivery. Late payments incur 2% interest per month.

4. Indemnification. Writer shall indemnify and hold harmless Client against any third‑party claims arising from the use of the deliverables, including alleged infringement of intellectual property rights, unless such claim results from Client’s own modifications.

5. Confidentiality. Both parties agree to keep confidential any proprietary information disclosed during the project.
